meanings.definition: The act of bringing about or carrying out something.
meanings.sent1: Her effectuations in the project were commendable.
meanings.sent2: The effectuations of the plan were successful.
meanings.sent3: His effectuations in the kitchen always lead to delicious meals.
meanings.sent4: The effectuations of her hard work blossomed into success.
meanings.sent5: The effectuations of the experiment were visible to all.

meanings.definition: The result or outcome of a particular action or process.
meanings.sent1: The effectuations of the meeting were positive.
meanings.sent2: We eagerly awaited the effectuations of our efforts.
meanings.sent3: The effectuations of the game left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent4: The effectuations of his decision were felt throughout the company.
meanings.sent5: The effectuations of the storm were evident in the flooded streets.
